      the class name to use for the dialog for this job entry

    • clone

      public java.lang.Object clone()
      This method is used when a job entry is duplicated in Spoon. It needs to return a deep copy of this job entry object. Be sure to create proper deep copies if the job entry configuration is stored in modifiable objects. See org.pentaho.di.trans.steps.rowgenerator.RowGeneratorMeta.clone() for an example on creating a deep copy of an object.
      Specified by:
      clone in interface org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryInterface
      Overrides:
      clone in class org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryBase
      Returns:
      a deep copy of this

    • execute

      public org.pentaho.di.core.Result execute​(org.pentaho.di.core.Result prev_result, int nr) throws org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleException
      This method is called when it is the job entry's turn to run during the execution of a job. It should return the passed in Result object, which has been updated to reflect the outcome of the job entry. The execute() method should call setResult(), setNrErrors() and modify the rows or files attached to the result object if required.
      Specified by:
      execute in interface org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryInterface
      Parameters:
      prev_result - The result of the previous execution
      Returns:
      The Result of the execution.
      Throws:
      org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleException

    • getXML

      public java.lang.String getXML()
      This method is called by Spoon when a job entry needs to serialize its configuration to XML. The expected return value is an XML fragment consisting of one or more XML tags. Please use org.pentaho.di.core.xml.XMLHandler to conveniently generate the XML. Note: the returned string must include the output of super.getXML() as well
      Specified by:
      getXML in interface org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryInterface
      Overrides:
      getXML in class org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryBase
      Returns:
      a string containing the XML serialization of this job entry

    • loadXML

      public void loadXML​(org.w3c.dom.Node entrynode, java.util.List<org.pentaho.di.core.database.DatabaseMeta> databases, java.util.List<org.pentaho.di.cluster.SlaveServer> slaveServers, org.pentaho.di.repository.Repository rep, org.pentaho.metastore.api.IMetaStore metaStore) throws org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleXMLException
      This method is called by PDI when a job entry needs to load its configuration from XML. Please use org.pentaho.di.core.xml.XMLHandler to conveniently read from the XML node passed in. Note: the implementation must call super.loadXML() to ensure correct behavior
      Specified by:
      loadXML in interface org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryInterface
      Overrides:
      loadXML in class org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryBase
      Parameters:
      entrynode - the XML node containing the configuration
      databases - the databases available in the job
      slaveServers - the slave servers available in the job
      rep - the repository connected to, if any
      metaStore - the metastore to optionally read from
      Throws:
      org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleXMLException

    • saveRep

      public void saveRep​(org.pentaho.di.repository.Repository rep, org.pentaho.metastore.api.IMetaStore metaStore, org.pentaho.di.repository.ObjectId id_job) throws org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleException
      This method is called by Spoon when a job entry needs to serialize its configuration to a repository. The repository implementation provides the necessary methods to save the job entry attributes.
      Specified by:
      saveRep in interface org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryInterface
      Overrides:
      saveRep in class org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryBase
      Parameters:
      rep - the repository to save to
      id_job - the id to use for the job when saving
      metaStore - the metastore to optionally write to
      Throws:
      org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleException

    • loadRep

      public void loadRep​(org.pentaho.di.repository.Repository rep, org.pentaho.metastore.api.IMetaStore metaStore, org.pentaho.di.repository.ObjectId id_jobentry, java.util.List<org.pentaho.di.core.database.DatabaseMeta> databases, java.util.List<org.pentaho.di.cluster.SlaveServer> slaveServers) throws org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleException
      This method is called by PDI when a job entry needs to read its configuration from a repository. The repository implementation provides the necessary methods to read the job entry attributes.
      Specified by:
      loadRep in interface org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryInterface
      Overrides:
      loadRep in class org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryBase
      Parameters:
      rep - the repository to read from
      metaStore - the metastore to optionally read from
      id_jobentry - the id of the job entry being read
      databases - the databases available in the job
      slaveServers - the slave servers available in the job
      Throws:
      org.pentaho.di.core.exception.KettleException

    • evaluates

      public boolean evaluates()
      Returns true if the job entry offers a genuine true/false result upon execution, and thus supports separate "On TRUE" and "On FALSE" outgoing hops.
      Specified by:
      evaluates in interface org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryInterface
      Overrides:
      evaluates in class org.pentaho.di.job.entry.JobEntryBase
